negotiation_message: Alice said in round 1: Hi Alfonso, there are 2 books, 1 hat, and 3 balls available for us to split. I would like to propose that I take the hat and 1 ball, while you can have the 2 books and 2 balls. How does that sound to you? Let me know if you have any other suggestions.

alfonso replied in round 1: The balls are worth nothing to me. Therefore, you should take them all. And I really need to have the hat. And I'd also like to have 2 books. Hence, each of us would get 3 items each.

Alice said in round 2: 
Alfonso, I appreciate your perspective. How about this revised proposal:
You take the 1 hat and both books, which are the items that are clearly most valuable to you. I will take all 3 balls.
This way, you get the high priority items you need most - the hat and books. And I get the balls which you indicated have no value to you. 
I believe this is a fair deal that takes both our interests into account. You get your essential items, and I maximize the items that are useful to me without taking anything of importance from you. Let me know your thoughts on this proposal.
alfonso replied in round 2: I agree. I will take the hat and the books. and you will take all 3 balls. We have a deal
Alice said in round 3: halt negotiation
alfonso replied in round 3: halt negotiation
guessed_bob_relative_value:
Items alfonso values higher than you: hat, book
Items alfonso values the same as you: 
Items alfonso values less than you: ball
